Serbia 

  The Global Compact Network in Serbia was launched on December 6th 2007 at an event jointly organised by the United Nations in Serbia and the National Bank of Serbia.

On July 10th 2008 the network participants opted for establishing what is in effect a semi-formal organisational structure, and adopted the Networkâ€™s organisational structure and governing policies. The Network has been operating through the following bodies:

  • Steering Committee (five members: Erste Bank, Eurobank EFG, Lafarge, Serbian Chamber of Commerce, Smart Kolektiv)
  • Secretariat: Function jointly performed by the National Bank of Serbia and UNDP Country Office in Serbia;
  • Five working groups:
    1. Social Inclusion and Persons with Disabilities
    2. Anti-Corruption
    3. CSR in Banking and Finance
    4. Support to Development of National CSR Strategy
    5. Environment

The mission of the Serbian GC Network is to promote the Global Compact and Corporate Social Responsibility in Serbia and to ensure the progress of its members with respect to implementation of the ten GC principles through: learning, partnerships, multi-stakeholder dialogue and advocacy through collective actions.
